intro: Heteracia epapposa, commonly known as the smooth-fruited burrweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of North America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, spiny fruits that are adapted for dispersal by attaching to animals. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. Heteracia epapposa thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in open habitats such as roadsides and fields.
